info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 1:58PM EDT until June 16 at 2:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Cumberland County in central Virginia... East central Prince Edward County in central Virginia... Northern Nottoway County in south central Virginia... Amelia County in central Virginia... * Until 245 PM EDT. * At 158 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Rice, or 7 miles east of Longwood University, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Jetersville and Morven around 220 PM EDT. Amelia Courthouse around 235 PM EDT. Mannboro, Scotts Fork and Chula around 245 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Paineville, Maplewood, Angola, Fergusonville, Stoddert, Earls, Deatonville, Rodophil, Truxillo and Denaro. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
